translation.en: [Todd singing, clanging a pot] ♪ Joy to the world, Todd is here ♪
♪ He drank up all your beer ♪♪
Oh, I'm sorry, did I startle you with holiday cheer
and good will towards man?
No, I just had this terrible dream that you were a person that existed
translation.ko: 끔찍한 악몽을 꿨어 넌 실제 사람이었고

translation.en: and that you were in my room for some reason.
translation.ko: 왠지 모르지만 내 침실에 와 있었어

translation.en: And then I woke up and it was true.
Do you know what day it is?
Oh, shit, is it like our anniversary
of that one day that I forgot to tell you how annoying you are?
No, that was July 14th.
You can remember it because it's also Bastille Day.
Christ, are you annoying.
BoJack, it's Christmas!
Well, don't get too excited.
I didn't get you shit. Ha! Shows what you know.
When you were passed out, I used your credit card
to buy me this new hat.
Merry Christmas to me.
It looks exactly like your old hat.
Yeah, it's my favorite kind of hat. Thanks, buddy!
translation.ko: 네, 내 취향에 딱 맞죠 고마워요, 친구

translation.en: Okay, great, Christmas transaction complete.
Please leave now.
Or we could watch Sabrina's Christmas Wish.
Hard pass.
What? Come on, you love Horsin' Around.
Yeah, but I always skip the Christmas ones.
translation.ko: 난 성탄절 특집은 원래 안 봐

translation.en: Because the themes of family and togetherness
are a chilling reminder of your own isolation?
No, but thank you for that.
Todd, special holiday episodes are always stupid.
translation.ko: 성탄절 특집 편은 죄다 바보 같아

translation.en: Cynical cash grabs by greedy corporations
looking to squeeze a few extra Nielsen points
out of sentimental claptrap for mush-brained idiots
who'd rather spend their Christmas watching a fake family on TV
than actually trying to have a conversation
with their own dumb families.
I like it when people on TV hug each other.
translation.ko: 난 TV에서 사람들이 포옹하는 게 좋던데

translation.en: Oh, come on, buddy!
It's Christmas!
Fine, if it'll make you shut up, I begrudgingly acquiesce
translation.ko: 널 닥치게 할 수 있다면 30분 동안

translation.en: to a half-hour of shared holiday acknowledgment,
translation.ko: 휴일 분위기 내는 걸 떨떠름하게 묵인해 줄게

translation.en: but only because I get a residual check
every time somebody watches one of them.
translation.ko: 내가 돈을 받기 때문인 줄 알아

translation.en: Hurray! Begrudging acquiescence!
♪ Without a home or a family tree ♪
♪ Horsin' Around ♪♪
[narrator] Horsin' Around is filmed before a live studio audience.
Eggs sunny side up, just like you like 'em.
translation.ko: 좋아하시는 대로 달걀 한 쪽만 구웠어요

translation.en: The hash has been thoroughly browned
and your pancakes have extra chocolate chips.
Any questions?
Just the one. Who are you and what have you done with Olivia?
Can't a sweet, young, lovable orphan
make breakfast for her favorite horse
without having ulterior motives?
translation.ko: 가장 좋아하는 말의 아침상을 차리면 안 돼요?

translation.en: You're right, I'm sorry, Olivia, this is very sweet.
And speaking of ulterior motives...
Well, I walked into that one.
That cute leather jacket I like is on sale at the galleria.
translation.ko: 그 깜찍한 가죽 재킷이 세일 중이에요

translation.en: As always, all roads lead to a cute leather jacket.
I gotta say, I've never understood
the appeal of fashionable clothing.
Um, that's the understatement of the century.
Trends come and go,
but give me a pair of sensible winter socks,
and for years to come, I can keep my tootsies toasty.
translation.ko: 몇 년 동안 발을 따뜻하게 해줘

translation.en: Haven't you kids ever heard that it's better to give than to receive?
translation.ko: 받는 것보다 주는 기쁨이 더 크단 걸 모르니?

translation.en: Well, by that logic, isn't giving you the opportunity
translation.ko: 그렇다면 가죽 재킷을 사줄 기회를 주는 게

translation.en: to give me a leather jacket really the best gift of all?
translation.ko: 내가 줄 수 있는 최고의 선물 아닐까요?

translation.en: Well, I've heard of a one jacket mind,
but this is ridiculous.
"One jacket mind"? What the hell is a one jacket mind?
I just want to look good
translation.ko: 난 조이 사라토가의 오토바이를 탈 때

translation.en: when I'm on the back of Joey Saratoga's motorcycle.
Besides, I've never had a Christmas before
and I want to make sure this one's really special.
Hold on, you mean to tell me you've never had a Christmas
translation.ko: 고아원에 있을 때 성탄절을 챙긴 적이

translation.en: at the orphanage? What's a Christ... mas?
What's a Christmas?
Only the most wonderful time of the year.
translation.ko: 일 년 중 가장 행복한 시기야

translation.en: You hang up stockings, sing carols,
and wait up for Santa Claus.
What's a Santa Claus?
What's a Santa Claus?
Is there an echo in here?
Santa Claus is the best.
He's this jolly old fat man who lives up at the North Pole,
and every year he flies all over the world
leaving presents for all the good boys and girls.
We get presents just for being good?
That's too much, man.
[audience member] That's my favorite line!
That's right, but you have to be really good
because Santa Claus is always watching.
Even when we go to the bathroom?
That's too much, man.
[audience member] Yeah, she said it again!
This Santa Claus guy sounds like a real piece of work.
You kids just wait,
this is gonna be the best Christmas you ever had.
translation.ko: 여태 경험한 성탄절 중 최고가 될 테니까

translation.en: So, better than no Christmas?
A thousand times better.
A thousand times zero is still zero.
Ethan, you want those winter socks?
Do I?
Then don't be such a wise guy over here, eh?
Is Mr. Liberatore in?
Look at you all business.
No, "Hello, Tracy.
Your hair looks nice, Tracy.
How's your mother, Tracy?"
Ah, sorry, Trace, I'm just trying to get ahead
so I don't have to work on Christmas this year.
Since when do you care about workin' on Christmas?
Are those little rug rats making you soft?
No way, I'm still the top earner at this firm.
translation.ko: 그럴 리가요, 난 여전히 최고의 직원이에요

translation.en: I'll buzz Mr. Liberatore and let him know you're here.
I know he wanted to check your progress on the Manzanita briefs.
Tracy, if you wanted to see my briefs,
all you had to do was ask.
Why, if I didn't know any better, I'd say you were flirting with me.
translation.ko: 설마 지금 내게 추파 던지는 거예요?

translation.en: [audience member] Kiss her!
Mr. Liberatore is gonna make me come in on Christmas, I can feel it.
translation.ko: 리버토르 씨가 성탄절에도 일을 시킬 것 같아요

translation.en: You know, he has got to be the meanest, snootiest, penny-pinchingest...
And he's right behind me, isn't he?
[Mr. Liberatore] Actually, I'm listening over the intercom.
I can't say I'm not disappointed.
Time was, I thought you were a go-getter.
translation.ko: 난 자네가 열정이 있는 줄 알았거든

translation.en: Hey, I go, I get.
Ever since those orphans moved in,
you've become awfully distracted.
If you want to be made partner,
you'll have to show some initiative.
You know, Jacob Goldstein's coming in on Christmas.
Jacob Goldstein's Jewish! He is?
The boys at the country club are not gonna like that.
Anyway, you can spend Christmas morning
with your little tater tots,
but I want you in here by the afternoon.
Remember, this is your career we're talking about.
translation.ko: 자네 커리어가 걸린 문제란 거 잊지 말게

translation.en: It's quiet.
Too quiet.
Go home, Goober!
translation.ko: - 집에 가, 구버 - 집에 가, 구버

translation.en: For your information, I was invited here personally
by The Horse himself to sprinkle a little holiday magic
into your dull, Gooberless lives.
Since when does Santa wear sunglasses?
I thought it was time old Saint Nick
got a bit of an update, you know what I'm sayin'?
Let me guess, instead of "Ho, Ho, Ho,"
it's "Yo, Yo, Yo."
And, uh, maybe later I could get you
under the mistletoe-toe-toe?
I've got three words for you Goober:
no, no, no.
[audience member] Kiss her!
All right, Sabrina, are you ready for the big surprise?
A tree inside the house?
Now I've seen everything.
And that's not all. Look who came to visit.
translation.ko: 그게 다가 아냐 누가 왔는지 봐

translation.en: Hey!
Go home, Goober.
No, that's not Goober, it's Santa.
Please, I'd recognize that cologne anywhere.
You had to wear the cologne.
[Todd] Ha, classic Goober.
Are you gonna keep talking? 'Cause I'll just pause it.
Okay, okay, I won't talk.
You're getting into it, aren't you?
No, why are we doing this?
You have to watch cheesy old holiday specials on Christmas,
translation.ko: 성탄절 땐 촌스러운 특집 방송을 봐야 해요

translation.en: it's tradition. Why? They're never any good.
Things don't become traditions because they're good, BoJack.
They become good because they're traditions.
You know, you can't just make yourself sound smart
by saying things backwards.
Oh, I can't, can't I?
Still don't believe I let you talk me into this.
translation.ko: 네 꾐에 넘어가다니 믿을 수 없다

translation.en: And I still don't believe Goober
ended up molesting all those Laker Girls.
Goober did not molest those Laker Girls,
the actor who played Goober molested those Laker Girls.
translation.ko: 구버 역을 맡았던 배우가 그런 거지

translation.en: Hey, this is nice, right?
No, shut up.
All right, all right, little lady, you got me.
But, uh, listen, I'm actually workin' for Santa
as one of his helpers, so anything you say to me
I can relay to the big man himself.
Is there anything you want to ask Santa for?
translation.ko: 산타에게 선물로 받고 싶은 거 있어?

translation.en: Now's your chance, anything you want.
Well, I guess what I really want is a personalized pencil set.
translation.ko: 난 이름 새겨진 연필 세트를 받고 싶어요

translation.en: A pencil set? Sabrina!
At the orphanage, I always had to share everything.
If I pencils that had my name on them,
everyone would know, "Hey, these pencils are Sabrina's!
translation.ko: 다들 내 연필이란 걸 알 테니

translation.en: Hands off, bumsky!"
I don't think you're getting this whole Christmas thing.
translation.ko: 아직 성탄절을 잘 이해 못 했구나

translation.en: You can ask for anything, you don't have to be shy.
Well, I guess I wouldn't mind a Pretty Pony Princess play set.
translation.ko: 예쁜 조랑말 공주 장난감을 갖고 싶긴 해요

translation.en: Now you're thinking Christmas.
Keep going, what do you want more than anything else in the world?
I can ask Santa for anything?
Anything at all.
And if I'm good, Santa has to give it to me?
That's the deal, as long as you're good,
all your Christmas dreams will come true.
Okay, I know what I want.
Santa, I want my Mommy and Daddy to come back.
This is gonna be the best Christmas ever.
[Todd] Look how sad you are,
you're a really good actor.
Are you gonna interrupt every five minutes?
Because I will ask you to leave.
And spend Christmas by yourself?
No one should be alone on Christmas.
Did we learn nothing from John McClane in "Die Hard"?
John McClane was alone on Christmas, that's how he saved the day.
translation.ko: 맥클레인은 성탄절에 혼자 있어서 영웅이 됐어

translation.en: He wasn't alone, he had that cop helping him,
the dad from Family Matters.
That wasn't the dad from Family Matters, it was just the same actor.
I'm pretty sure it's supposed to be the same character,
they're both cops.
Yeah, but one was a cop in Los Angeles and the other was a cop in Chicago.
translation.ko: 하나는 LA 경찰이고 하나는 시카고 경찰이잖아

translation.en: Maybe he moved.
He didn't move, they had different names!
Witness Protection.
Hey, this is nice, right?
No!
Oh, Charles Krauthammer, you have done it again.
Yes, Mr. Liberatore.
Of course, Mr. Liberatore, I'll get right on it, sir.
Yeesh, I've heard of being a work horse,
but this is ridiculous.
I just hate that he's making you work on Christmas.
What is this, Communist Russia?
I know, it's a bummer,
but we can find other times to be together.
translation.ko: 오늘 대신 다른 날을 함께 보내자

translation.en: Hey, maybe I'll chaperone your prom.
I can meet all your friends,
talk you up to this Joey Saratoga fella,
maybe even take a spin on the dance floor.
You know, back in my day,
I could really bust the regular move.
Well, just got done shoveling the walk!
I'm being really good just so there's no confusion for Santa
translation.ko: 산타가 헷갈리지 않도록 정말 착하게 굴고 있어

translation.en: over whether or not he should make my Christmas wish come true.
Santa, if you're listening, I'm Sabrina!
Sabrina, I'm glad you're getting into the Christmas spirit,
but, you know, bringing your parents back
is a pretty tall order.
Not for Santa.
Santa can do anything,
just as long as I believe, right, guys?
You wanna handle this one?
Sabrina, there are some things even Santa can't do.
translation.ko: 사브리나, 산타조차 못 하는 것들이 있어

translation.en: Okay, I get what's happening.
You're trying to make me think
Santa won't bring me my Mommy and Daddy
so that when he does, I'll be even more surprised.
translation.ko: 진짜 돌아왔을 때 더 놀라게 하려는 거죠?

translation.en: Just when I thought Christmas couldn't get any more magical.
See you later!
I've heard of great Christmas expectations,
but this is ridiculous.
Now no matter what Santa brings,
she'll go from "reindeer" to "reindon't."
What are we gonna do?
Horse, maybe you should tell her that her parents aren't coming.
I can't do that, she'll never believe in Santa Claus again.
translation.ko: 그럼 두 번 다시 산타를 안 믿을 거야

translation.en: And we're sure Santa can't bring people back from the dead?
translation.ko: 산타가 죽은 사람을 살릴 수 없는 거 맞아요?

translation.en: On Dancer, on Prancer, on Necromancer?
I'm thinkin' no.
Oh, my God, I got it.
Maybe if we can trick her into being bad,
translation.ko: 사브리나를 속여서 못된 짓을 하게 한 뒤

translation.en: she'll think Santa's mad at her.
That way, when Christmas comes and her parents don't show up,
translation.ko: 그럼 성탄절 때 부모님이 안 와도

translation.en: she'll just think it's her own fault.
Brilliant! She'll still believe in Santa,
translation.ko: 맞아! 그럼 산타를 계속 믿을 거고

translation.en: plus she'll be extra well-behaved for the whole year
translation.ko: 한 해 동안 특별히 착하게 굴 거야

translation.en: so she doesn't blow it again.
Hold on, you kids want me to trick Sabrina into being bad
translation.ko: 잠깐, 사브리나가 산타를 계속 믿게 하려고

translation.en: just so she won't stop believing Santa?
Never in a million years would I resort to something so low.
translation.ko: 난 그런 비열한 짓은 절대 못 해

translation.en: No, we better keep brainstorming
because I am definitely not doing that idea.
How desperate do you think I am?
You are really scraping the bottom of the barrel with that one.
No, I will clearly not be pursuing that line of action.
translation.ko: 안 돼 그 짓은 절대 못 해

translation.en: No way, no how.
So, you want me to sit here and watch the cookies
but not eat them?
This seems like a trick.
[audience member] He's doing the thing he said he wasn't gonna do!
These cookies are for Santa.
If anyone eats them, he'll be really mad.
I need you to guard them.
It's a very important job.
Well, I guess it is about time
I start earning my keep around here.
I knew I could count on you.
Remember, no matter what, don't eat these delicious,
home made, fresh out of the oven,
warm, gooey, chocolate chip delights.
translation.ko: 초콜릿 칩 쿠키를 먹어선 안 돼

translation.en: I'll leave you here alone... with these cookies...
translation.ko: 난 이만 가마 너랑 쿠키만 남는 거야

translation.en: which are delicious.
Okay, cookies, it's just you and me.
Ooh, they look so yummy.
What would Mommy and Daddy say?
"Sabrina, I'm your Daddy and I say, 'Don't eat the cookies!'"
"Listen to your Father, honey, he knows what's best."
Okay, Mommy and Daddy, I love you.
I don't think she's taking the bait.
That's because you didn't put any milk out.
You can't have cookies without milk.
That's like Wang without the Chung.
Any chance she'll crack?
I'd say your odds are about as good
as a democrat being elected president.
Yeesh, I've heard of "lookie, lookie, don't eat the cookie,"
but this is ridiculous.
What?
You guys got any other bright ideas?
Maybe I should go eat the cookies?
Well, if she's not gonna, somebody should.
[Olivia] Oh, my God, it's Christmas! [Ethan] Oh, it's Christmas!
Yes, sensible winter socks! You knew!
Ooh, what could this be?
Well, I wanted to make sure you look really cool
on the back of that motorcycle.
You didn't! You didn't!
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼, 말도 안 돼

translation.en: You didn't.
Motorcycle crashes are one of the leading causes of brain injury.
translation.ko: 오토바이 사고는 뇌 손상의 주요 원인이야

translation.en: If Joey Saratoga doesn't care about this,
translation.ko: 조이 사라토가가 네 머리를 아끼지 않는다면

translation.en: then Joey Saratoga doesn't care about you.
Wow, this present shows you really care,
so in a way it's even cooler than a new leather jacket.
Take it from me, being safe is totally radical.
translation.ko: 안전을 챙기는 것도 충분히 멋진 일이야

translation.en: Is this my present?
It's a Pretty Pony Princess play set, just like you asked for.
Is that it?
Well, it's pretty cool.
She comes with a tiara and everything.
Oh, okay.
And cue the waterworks in 30, 29, 28...
...four, three, two...
and...
Hey, what's this?
A letter? Who could this be from?
Open it, Sabrina.
What does it say?
How should I know? I can't read.
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 알아? 난 못 읽잖아

translation.en: "Dear Sabrina, this is a letter from your parents.
Even though we can't be with you on Christmas,
we're in heaven looking down on you
and we want you to know we love you very much.
You are a good girl and we are very proud of you.
translation.ko: '넌 정말 착한 아이고 우린 네가 자랑스러워'

translation.en: Love, Your Mommy and Daddy."
Isn't that great, Sabrina?
A letter from your Mom and Dad.
-No, that's not what I asked for. -Sabrina--
I didn't want a stupid letter, I wanted my Mommy and Daddy.
translation.ko: 난 바보 같은 편지 말고 엄마, 아빠를 원했어요

translation.en: I know you're upset, but--
I hate this.
I hate Santa Claus and I hate trees
and I hate you and I hate Christmas!
Was it something I said?
Why would it be something Ethan said?
No, that's the joke, it wasn't something Ethan said,
translation.ko: 말실수 안 했다는 게 웃음 포인트잖아

translation.en: that's why it's funny.
Okay.
Can I come in?
Even if I say no,
it's not like anyone ever listens to what I want.
translation.ko: 어차피 내 말은 아무도 안 듣는데요 뭐

translation.en: Sabrina, I really screwed things up.
I got so excited trying to make you excited,
translation.ko: 널 들뜨게 하는 데 너무 몰입해서

translation.en: I forgot the true meaning of Christmas.
Christmas isn't about getting everything you want.
translation.ko: 성탄절은 원하는 걸 얻는 날이 아냐

translation.en: It's about being around the people that care about you.
I did everything right.
Why wouldn't Santa Claus want me to be happy?
translation.ko: 산타는 왜 내 행복을 바라지 않죠?

translation.en: I'm sure he does, he just--
Santa Claus works in mysterious ways.
translation.ko: 산타가 뭔가를 하는 데는 이유가 있어

translation.en: It's like when I make you eat vegetables.
translation.ko: 내가 채소 먹으라고 하는 것과 똑같아

translation.en: Sure, they taste yucky,
but you have to trust that I know what's good for you.
So, Santa Claus made my parents dead
translation.ko: 산타가 우리 부모님을 죽게 한 건

translation.en: because he thinks it's good for me?
Yeah-- No!
Santa Claus didn't make your parents dead.
translation.ko: 산타가 부모님을 죽게 한 게 아냐

translation.en: But he didn't save them either.
No, he-- That's not how Santa works.
You said Santa Claus is always watching,
so if he's watching why doesn't he help us?
translation.ko: 늘 보고 있다면 왜 돕지 않죠?

translation.en: Does he enjoy watching us be sad?
Is that how he gets his kicks?
Are we all just pawns in Santa's sick game?
translation.ko: 우린 산타의 역겨운 게임에 놀아나고 있어요?

translation.en: What kind of pervert is he?
Oh, no, Santa's watching us right now!
I'm sorry, Santa!
I didn't mean it.
Please don't hurt the people I love.
translation.ko: 내가 사랑하는 사람을 아프게 하지 마요

translation.en: No, Sabrina, Santa Claus isn't real.
-What? -[audience groans]
He's a lie that grownups made up because we like to believe that
there's an order to the universe
and that good behavior will lead to happiness,
translation.ko: 착하게 살면 행복할 거라 믿고 싶지만

translation.en: but the fact is that just isn't true. [audience member] What?
You can't be good
just because you think some fat guy in a red suit
is gonna bring you presents.
You have to be good just to be good. That's all there is.
translation.ko: 착하게 살기 위해서 착하게 살아야 한다고

translation.en: Whoa. Look, I don't know why things happen,
I don't know why some people get everything
translation.ko: 왜 어떤 사람은 모든 걸 갖고

translation.en: and some people are orphans.
All I know is I spent last Christmas alone at my office.
translation.ko: 하지만 지난 성탄절에 난 회사에서 혼자 보냈고

translation.en: I didn't get a tree,
I didn't put up any decorations or sing carols,
translation.ko: 장식도 하지 않고 캐럴도 부르지 않고

translation.en: and I didn't try to get any little girls to believe in Santa Claus.
translation.ko: 네가 산타를 믿게 하려고 노력하지도 않았어

translation.en: Sabrina, you and Olivia and Ethan
are the best things that have ever happened to me,
and if it took your parents dying
for you to be part of my life, well, then I'm glad your parents died.
translation.ko: 네가 내 삶에 온 게 참 다행이야

translation.en: Oh, you don't mean that.
No, I do, I'm glad your parents are dead
and are never coming back.
Well, when you put it that way, I guess I am, too.
I know that sometimes I make a mess of this whole thing,
translation.ko: 내가 완벽하지 않은 건 나도 알아

translation.en: a horse raising three human kids while also
translation.ko: 말로서 세 인간을 키우며 직장 다니고

translation.en: juggling work and trying to have a love life thing,
translation.ko: 말로서 세 인간을 키우며 직장 다니고 연애까지 하는 건 힘들거든 참, 선물 하나 더 줄게

translation.en: but there's one more present.
translation.ko: 연애까지 하는 건 힘들거든 참, 선물 하나 더 줄게

translation.en: Is it from Santa Claus?
No, it's from me.
Wow, pencils! What do they say?
Sound it out.
Sa... Sab...
Sabrin...
rine...
rine...
Sab...
Sabrine...
Sabrinay.
Sabrinay.
-It says Sabrina. -Oh!
I can't bring your Mommy and Daddy back, but as long as I'm around,
translation.ko: 부모님은 되살릴 수 없지만 내가 있는 한

translation.en: you'll always have a place to keep your pencils.
translation.ko: 연필 둘 곳은 언제나 있을 거란다

translation.en: Thanks.
Maybe it's just because I never had a Christmas before,
but this is the best Christmas I've ever had.
translation.ko: 내 생애 최고의 성탄절인 것 같아요

translation.en: Me, too.
Olivia, Ethan, look what I got!
[Mr. Liberatore] Hello?
Listen, Mr. Liberatore,
I've given it a lot of thought and I'm not--
Well, I'm not comin' in to work today.
If I have to choose between my career and the people I care about,
translation.ko: 일과 사랑하는 사람 중에 골라야 한다면

translation.en: well, then I'm sorry, but I'm putting people first.
[Mr. Liberatore] You know, it took guts to call in and tell me that,
the kind of guts we need on our executive board.
If that Scrooge, Jacob Goldstein, wants to work on Christmas,
he can work somewhere else!
[audience member] Fire that Jew!
I'm making you partner.
Well, I'm really glad to hear that, Mr. Liberatore.
Now if you'll excuse me,
I have to go spend Christmas with the people I love.
Hi, I'm a Pretty Pony Princess.
I'm a pencil.
Well, I guess everything turned out okay.
translation.ko: 모든 게 잘 풀린 것 같네

translation.en: How'd you get her to come back down?
Let's just say I made her
an offer she couldn't refuse.
Well, I gotta hand it to you,
even though it didn't work,
that letter you wrote was really something.
I didn't write that letter. I thought you wrote that letter.
translation.ko: 내가 쓴 거 아닌데? 네가 쓰지 않았니?

translation.en: I didn't write the letter.
Wasn't me.
Then where'd it come from?
Well, that sucked.
So the letter was actually from her parents?
Uh, I think it was from Santa.
That's why there was a "ho, ho, ho" voice at the end.
So in the world of this show, there is a Santa.
translation.ko: 그러니까 시트콤 세계엔 산타가 있는 거네요

translation.en: No, I don't know, we were all on cocaine.
translation.ko: 아니, 나도 몰라 다들 코카인에 취했었어

translation.en: God, I can't believe I spent nine years of my life
making that dumb show.
It wasn't all dumb, BoJack.
The episode where Sabrina had a black friend
really started the conversation about racism.
And the episode where Ethan looked directly at a solar eclipse
really started the conversation
about not looking directly at a solar eclipse.
Yeah.
Well, anyway, Merry Christmas.
I know, it's really just another day
in a year full of days, nothing all that special about it
other than the significance we give it,
but still, I'm glad I got to spend part of the day with you, BoJack.
-Really? -Yeah.
Hey, um, Horsin' Around had eight other Christmas episodes.
translation.ko: '말 장난' 성탄절 특집이 여덟 편이나 더 있어

translation.en: If you're not doing anything else today, we could watch another one,
translation.ko: 오늘 바쁘지 않으면 한 편 더 볼까?

translation.en: I mean, just to see how stupid it is.
-Yeah? -Yeah.
But don't talk in the middle of it.
-Zip! -You can talk a little bit.
-Don't be weird about it. -Okay.
Hey, after we watch "Horsin' Around," can we make holiday cookies?
translation.ko: '말 장난' 본 다음에 성탄절 쿠키 만들까요?

translation.en: [BoJack] No.
-[Todd] Can we sing carols? -[BoJack] No.
-Can we roast a Christmas goose? -No.
-Can we play dreidel? -No.
-Can we get a tree? -No.
-Doesn't have to be a Christmas tree. -Still no.
-Can we be visited by three spirits? -No.
-Can we be visited by three kings? -No.
-Can we go outside and make snow angels? -What snow? It's 72 degrees out.
-Can we make driveway gravel angels? -No.
-Can we drink eggnog? -No.
-Bourbon and eggnog? -No.
-What about just bourbon? -Fine.
